title: While running on Photon OS, pulling packages from ghcr.io always results in 401 error

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

body:
### `brew config` output

```shell
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 3.3.9
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew
HEAD: 96137bc19e68398ebbb7033379df288cd8b9a3f9
Last commit: 11 days ago
Core tap ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core
Core tap HEAD: fad8c3ea3925beb085359f31b1a019b0487b6cf3
Core tap last commit: 20 minutes ago
Core tap branch: master
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_CORE_GIT_REMOTE: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core
HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN: set
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 1
Homebrew Ruby: 2.6.8 => /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/Homebrew/Library/Homebrew/vendor/portable-ruby/2.6.8/bin/ruby
CPU: single-core 64-bit westmere
Clang: N/A
Git: 2.30.0 => /bin/git
Curl: 7.78.0 => /bin/curl
Kernel: Linux 5.10.61-1.ph4-esx x86_64 GNU/Linux
OS: VMware Photon OS 4.0 (Photon)
Host glibc: 2.32
/usr/bin/gcc: N/A
/usr/bin/ruby: N/A
glibc: N/A
gcc@5: N/A
xorg: N/A
```


### `brew doctor` output

```shell
Please note that these warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers
with debugging if you file an issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is
working fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this. Thanks!

Warning: No developer tools installed.
Install Clang or run `brew install gcc`.
```


### Verification

- [X] I ran `brew update` and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [X] I have resolved all warnings from `brew doctor` and that did not fix my problem.

### What were you trying to do (and why)?

Simply trying to install some packages first, then attempting to resolve the warning :).

### What happened (include all command output)?

```shell
web@service [ ~ ]$ brew install gcc
==> Downloading https://ghcr.io/v2/homebrew/core/m4/manifests/1.4.19
curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 401

Error: gcc: Failed to download resource "m4_bottle_manifest"
Download failed: https://ghcr.io/v2/homebrew/core/m4/manifests/1.4.19
```

### What did you expect to happen?

Packages to install like normal.

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

I noticed that the curl request to download is messed up because on Photon OS at least, the lsb_release command doesn't support command line parameters to be combined. This is install ran with `--verbose`:

```shell
web@service [ ~ ]$ brew install gcc --verbose
==> Downloading https://ghcr.io/v2/homebrew/core/m4/manifests/1.4.19
/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/Homebrew/Library/Homebrew/shims/shared/curl --disable --cookie /dev/null --globoff --show-error --user-agent Linuxbrew/3.3.9\ \(Linux\;\ x86_64\ Distribution\ information.'
''
'Usage:\ lsb_release\ \[options\]'
''
'Options:'
'\ \ -h,\ --help\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ show\ this\ help\ message\ and\ exit'
'\ \ -i,\ --id\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ show\ distributor\ ID'
'\ \ -d,\ --description\ \ show\ description\ of\ this\ distribution'
'\ \ -r,\ --release\ \ \ \ \ \ show\ release\ number\ of\ this\ distribution'
'\ \ -c,\ --codename\ \ \ \ \ show\ code\ name\ of\ this\ distribution'
'\ \ -a,\ --all\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ show\ all\ of\ the\ above\ information'
'\ \ -s,\ --short\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ show\ requested\ information\ in\ short\ format\)\ curl/7.78.0 --header Accept-Language:\ en --fail --retry 3 --header Accept:\ application/vnd.oci.image.index.v1\+json --header Authorization:\ Bearer\ QQ== --location --remote-time --output /home/web/.cache/Homebrew/downloads/5b2a7f715487b7377e409e8ca58569040cd89f33859f691210c58d94410fd33b--m4-1.4.19.bottle_manifest.json.incomplete https://ghcr.io/v2/homebrew/core/m4/manifests/1.4.19
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
  0    73    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0
curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 401
Error: gcc: Failed to download resource "m4_bottle_manifest"
Download failed: https://ghcr.io/v2/homebrew/core/m4/manifests/1.4.19
```

If you run lsb_release with the parameters spaced out, then the command returns the expected output:

```shell
web@service [ ~ ]$ lsb_release -s -d
VMware Photon OS 4.0
```
